intro: Rubus rivularis var. spinosulus, commonly known as the bristly blackberry, is a shrub native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Rosaceae family.
